content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a function that extracts Julia code from Markdown:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    julia_blocks = filter(b -> startswith(b, "```julia") || startswith(b, "```{julia"), split(md, "\n"))
    julia_code = map(strip âˆ˜ replace, julia_blocks) do block
        lines = String.(split(block, "\n", keepempty=false))[2:end-1]
        return join(lines, '\n')
    end
    return join(julia_code, '\n\n')
end
```

This function splits the Markdown document into lines and filters out only those starting with "```julia" or "```{julia". It then maps over these blocks, removing any leading or trailing whitespace from each line and joining them together. Finally, it joins all the Julia code blocks back together with newlines in between.
